channel.title: CiTR -- News 101
channel.description: NEWS 101 is Vancouver's only live, volunteer-produced, student and community newscast. Every week, we take a look back at the week's local, national and international news, as seen from a fully independent media perspective.
channel.itunes:summary: NEWS 101 is Vancouver's only live, volunteer-produced, student and community newscast. Every week, we take a look back at the week's local, national and international news, as seen from a fully independent media perspective.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Vancouver's only live, volunteer-produced, student and community newscast.

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Oct-2011
item.description:
News 101
Our headlines cover local news from Vancouver, federal news from across Canada, as well as news from around the world. Also today, we shall be interviewing John Hayes right here in our studio. Hayes is a member of the Occupy Vancouver demonstrations set to take place in downtown Vancouver on Oct. 15, and since we at News 101 are very interested in the Occupy movement slowly spreading across the world, we had a well-informed discussion about the ideas fueling the frustrated minds behind this movement.
Free Speech Radio News - Headlines
News 101 Headlines: - B.C. teachers return to court to review class-size decision - Body found in Vancouver home destroyed by fire - 4.2 earthquake strikes off Vancouver Island; no injuries reported - Little Saigon gets the nod from city council - Government likely to intervene in Air Canada strike - Oil giant Sinopec buys Calgary-based Daylight Energy for $2.2B - COPE Candidates Woodsworth and Granby Support Creation of Farmersâ Market to Operate on Year Round Basis - UN warns of volatile food prices - Mexican City Linares' Police Force Detained For Corruption Investigation - Thailand Floods 2011: Bangkok Braces For Arrival Of Floods - Libya conflict: Pro-Gaddafi troops 'cornered' in Sirte
Interview/Discussion with John Hayes
item.itunes:subtitle: FSRN headlines | Canadian news | World news | Interview with John Hayes
